text: I found the answer and learnt something new but I will leave this here as a puzzle for a while.

elements.text: I found the answer and learnt something new but I will leave this here as a puzzle for a while.

text: A triangular matrix with 1 on the diagonal is precisely a Jordan block

elements.text: A triangular matrix with 1 on the diagonal is precisely a Jordan block

text: Isn't a Jordan block a bidiagonal matrix with a constant on the diagonal and 1 on the super- (or sub-) diagonal? So not exactly the same as a triangular matrix with 1 on the diagonal. However, the Jordan normal form of the latter will comprise a single Jordan block with 1 on both the diagonal and superdiagonal.

elements.text: Isn't a Jordan block a bidiagonal matrix with a constant on the diagonal and 1 on the super- (or sub-) diagonal? So not exactly the same as a triangular matrix with 1 on the diagonal. However, the Jordan normal form of the latter will comprise a single Jordan block with 1 on both the diagonal and superdiagonal.
